intro: Asyneuma parviflorum, commonly known as the small-flowered asyneuma, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers are arranged in clusters, and it produces small, oval-shaped fruits. Asyneuma parviflorum is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to withstand salt spray and strong winds.
